means: 欺骗，蒙骗( deceive的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Her husband had been deceiving her for years.
sentence.Network_cn: 她丈夫多年来一直在欺骗她。

sentence.Network_en: He should fear he was purposely deceiving him with empty promises.
sentence.Network_cn: 他会担心他是故意用空话来搪塞他.

sentence.Network_en: We now know that that regime was deceiving the world, and developing those weapons all along.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们现在知道,北韩政权在欺骗全世界, 一直在发展那些武器.

PerfectNetExp.abs: That first glance is very deceiving ., 第一眼是很有欺骗性的.
This character of a deceiving femme fatale is perfect for her ., 影片中具有欺骗性的致命女郎的角色显然很适合她.
However , appearances are deceiving ., 然而 , 表象往往带有欺骗性.
the laws help persons who deceived , not those deceiving .法律帮助受欺骗的人而不帮助行骗的人。

list.abs: o let not time deceive you ., 哦 , 还是不要让时间欺骗你吧.
in other words , Satan told them , God wasn't their friend after all. effect he was saying , " would a friend deceive you ? "换句话说，撒旦告诉他们，上帝毕竟不是他们的朋友，实际上撒旦在说：“朋友会骗你吗？
oral sex的意思中文翻译 ... deceive 欺骗, 行骗 deceive oneself 骗自己误解, 想错 deceiver 欺人者, 欺诈者.
"deceive"怎么说合适-翻译"deceive"... ... deceive vt 欺骗; deceive oneself 骗自己，误解，想错; 掩耳盗铃; to deceive 糊弄.
2008年2月27日 - then you are certainly deceiving yourself. ;那你肯定是在欺骗自己. Sincerity is the base of friendship.Good friends shouldn't deceive each.
Guy 的变体 Guyler [英格兰人姓氏] 盖勒。绰号，欺骗者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“欺瞒”(to deceive)＋er。

entry.def: If you deceive someone, you make them believe something that is not true, usually in order to get some advantage for yourself.

example.ex: He has deceived and disillusioned us all...
example.tran: 他欺骗了大家，让我们失望至极。

example.ex: If you can make the last 10 seconds exciting, you can deceive your audience into thinking it's been like that all along.
example.tran: 如果能让最后 10 秒钟紧张刺激，就可以给观众造成场面一直都是如此的假象。

entry.def: If you deceive yourself, you do not admit to yourself something that you know is true.

example.ex: Alcoholics are notorious for their ability to deceive themselves about the extent of their problem.
example.tran: 酗酒者善于在自身问题的严重性上自欺欺人，这是人所共知的。

entry.def: If something deceives you, it gives you a wrong impression and makes you believe something that is not true.

example.ex: His gentle, kindly appearance did not deceive me...
example.tran: 我没有被他文雅和善的外表所蒙蔽。

example.ex: The boys, if my eyes did not deceive me, were praying.
example.tran: 如果我没有看错的话，那些男孩子正在祈祷。

auth_sentence.content: This article is very deceiving in several ways.
auth_sentence.res_content: This article is very deceiving in several ways.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This article is very deceiving in several ways.

auth_sentence.content: "Tricks can be deceiving," Mr. Moseley says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "Tricks can be deceiving," Mr. Moseley says.

auth_sentence.content: The apparent wealth of the New York environment is deceiving.
auth_sentence.res_content: The apparent wealth of the New York environment is deceiving.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The apparent wealth of the New York environment is deceiving.
